newsitem.title: UK: Silk Industries shares rocket after results.
newsitem.headline: Silk Industries shares rocket after results.

text.p: Shares in Silk Industries Plc rose 47 percent on Monday after the company reported an 11 percent rise in pre-tax profits for the year ended February 28 1997 coupled with an upbeat statement on prospects.
Shares in the silk producer were up 32p at 100-1/2 by 1126 GMT in thin trade of 14,500 shares.
Pre-tax profit rose 11.8 percent to 2.6 million stg in the year ended February 28 on turnover up 12.3 percent at 16.3 million stg.
Earnings per share rose 13.9 percent to 15.6p and the total dividend for the year was raised to 7p from 6p.
Chairman Christopher Norland said the international market, particularly towards the luxury end, continued to expand, providing numerous opportunities for growth.
Norland said he was "pleased to report on a high level of activity and enthusiasm throughout the group" and that he was "looking forward to another year of good growth."
